intro: Minuartia rostrata subsp. stereoneura, commonly known as the rock louse or saxifrage, is a low-growing, mat-forming plant native to rocky and alpine environments. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and clusters of white or pink flowers. The subspecies stereoneura is distinguished by its elongated, pointed leaf tips and a more compact growth habit compared to other subspecies. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. This plant is adapted to harsh environments and plays a role in stabilizing soil in rocky habitats.
